channel.title: Dungeons and Dragons
channel.description: Just wondering if anyone here has played it before? I've always thought that D&D would be the line that I would cross in my nerdiness, but recently, I've been getting more and more interested in it. What are your experiences with it, is it easy to get in to?

I have all the discs and original books for the mmo

item.title: Dungeons and Dragons
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:13, topic:435648”][quote author=Newty link=topic=538369.msg3939294#msg3939294 date=1331280519]
I go to this med-evil festival every year with my stepdad and I shit you not the ‘game room’ they have setup for all the kids (mostly 20something year old tag-a-long weirdos) is full of DnD kids who full on act the shit out and get so into character its unreal…

I personally have never played the board game and I only very briefly played the MMO.

Probably would be fun with the right group of kids though and if you were under some type of influence
[/quote]

I’m thinking booze, and guys that like to play, but don’t cosplay would be pretty good. Also, not hardcore either (“Dude, you can’t do that. You only have 22 Agility, and you need to roll an 87 or higher to jump to the floor”[I don’t know if that’s what they do, but it’s what the “devoted” players do]). Just a nice laid back group of guys, trying their hardest to maintain a story while inebriated.[/quote]

Would be very fun from that description.

Read full topic

item.title: Dungeons and Dragons
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“Newty, post:12, topic:435648”]I go to this med-evil festival every year with my stepdad and I shit you not the ‘game room’ they have setup for all the kids (mostly 20something year old tag-a-long weirdos) is full of DnD kids who full on act the shit out and get so into character its unreal…

I personally have never played the board game and I only very briefly played the MMO.

Probably would be fun with the right group of kids though and if you were under some type of influence ;)[/quote]

I’m thinking booze, and guys that like to play, but don’t cosplay would be pretty good. Also, not hardcore either (“Dude, you can’t do that. You only have 22 Agility, and you need to roll an 87 or higher to jump to the floor”[I don’t know if that’s what they do, but it’s what the “devoted” players do]). Just a nice laid back group of guys, trying their hardest to maintain a story while inebriated.

Read full topic

item.title: Dungeons and Dragons
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

The boardgame. I didn’t know there was an MMO, although it seems a bit weird. Perhaps I’ll make an online version, that keeps its root (text based, the DM creates a tile-based map, upload maps to share, etc). But perhaps I should play it before trying to make an online version.

Read full topic

item.title: Dungeons and Dragons
item.dc:creator: @vManlyMan vManlyMan
item.description:
@vManlyMan wrote:

I’ve never played, but when I ride the bus home from school there are these 2 kids that talk about it nonstop. (Really just one kid talks and the other listens and runs off the bus the second he gets the chance to, probably to get away from the obssessed D&D kid). So if it’s as addicting as the kid makes it seem, then I’m never going to try it.

Read full topic
